application.name: apollopaninit
application.brief: Imports a complete (stitched) apollo panaramic image JP2 image
application.description: This program will import a merged JPEG2000 Apollo Panaramic Image. JPEG2000 files (JP2) is supported in the ISIS library. The JP2 file can have any number of bands up to 16384. The output from a JP2 file will be a multi-spectral ISIS image file.

history.change: Ripped of std2isis JPEG2000 import code to create ApolloPan2Isis
Fixed a memory error that came to light when adding support for Mac OSX10.8. References #1354.
Application category name changed from Import and Export to Apollo. Fixes mantis ticket #951.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the filename to import.

parameter.name: Microns
parameter.description: The size of the scanned image pixel in microns.

parameter.name: MISSION
parameter.description: The Apollo Mission that captured the input JPEG2000 image

parameter.name: GMT
parameter.description: GMT is space deliniated Year Month Day Hour Minute Seconds

parameter.name: LON_NADIR
parameter.description: Longitude of the the sub spacecraft nadir point in degrees.

parameter.name: LAT_NADIR
parameter.description: Latitude of the sub-spacecraft nadir point in degrees.

parameter.name: CRAFT_ALTITUDE
parameter.description: The distance from the center of the moon to the spacecraft in KM

parameter.name: LON_INT
parameter.description: The Longitude of the intersection of the primary camera axis with the surface of the moon.

parameter.name: LAT_INT
parameter.description: The Latitude of the intersection of the primary camera azis with the surface of the moon.

parameter.name: VEL_AZM
parameter.description: Azimuth of the velocity vector. Measured in degrees clockwise from north in the local horizontal plane

parameter.name: VEL_HORIZ
parameter.description: The magnitude of the horizontal velocity (parral to local horizontal plane) in km/s.

parameter.name: VEL_RADIAL
parameter.description: The average velcity in the spacecraft radial direction in KM/sec.

parameter.name: V/H_OVERRIDE
parameter.brief: User can optionally override the V/H with this parameter (Milli-Radians/seccond)
parameter.description: Nominally the V/H can be calucalated from the other input parameters. However, during some periods of the mission the V/H sensor was stuck and did not adjust image to image. In those cases this manual override can be used.
